TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit PropertyConverter extends System.Object
public ref class PropertyConverter abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Contains helper functions to convert property values to and from strings.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.PropertyConverter> class is used by the ASP.NET page framework and is not intended to be accessed directly from your code. You can use the <xref:System.Enum> structure to convert string values to and from enumerators, or <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> to convert objects.

static member EnumFromString : Type * string -> obj

Docs.param: A that represents the enumeration type to create from the parameter.
The that represents a value in the enumerator.
Docs.summary: Converts the string representation to a value of the specified enumeration type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.PropertyConverter.EnumFromString%2A> method is used to convert a string value to its equivalent enumeration value.
> [!NOTE] > This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. To convert a string value to its equivalent enumeration value, use the <xref:System.Enum.Parse%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.

Docs.exception:
is not an .
\- or -
is either an empty string ("") or contains only white spaces.
\- or -
is a name, but not one of the named constants defined for the enumeration.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.PropertyConverter.EnumToString%2A> method is used to convert an enumeration value to its equivalent string representation.
> [!NOTE] > This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. To convert an enumeration value to its equivalent string representation, use the <xref:System.Enum.Format%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.

static member ObjectFromString : Type * System.Reflection.MemberInfo * string -> obj

Docs.param: The properties to use during conversion.
The to convert into an object.
Docs.summary: Converts the string value to the specified object type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.PropertyConverter.ObjectFromString%2A> method is used to convert a string value to an object.
> [!NOTE] > This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. To convert a string value to an object, use the `Parse` method for that object if the object provides a `Parse` method. For example, an <xref:System.Int32> object can be created from a string through the <xref:System.Int32.Parse%2A> method.

Docs.exception: An object of the type specified by cannot be created from the parameter.
